Package com.linecorp.armeria.client.retry

Interface RetryStrategy

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
    @FunctionalInterface
public interface RetryStrategy
    Determines whether a failed request should be retried. If you need to determine by looking into the Response, use RetryStrategyWithContent.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static Backoff defaultBackoff
      Deprecated.
      Use Backoff.ofDefault().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static RetryStrategy never()
      A RetryStrategy that defines a retry should not be performed.
      static RetryStrategy onServerErrorStatus()
      Returns the RetryStrategy that retries the request with the Backoff.ofDefault() when the response status matches HttpStatusClass.SERVER_ERROR or an Exception is raised.
      static RetryStrategy onServerErrorStatus​(Backoff backoff)
      Returns the RetryStrategy that retries the request with the specified backoff when the response status matches HttpStatusClass.SERVER_ERROR or an Exception is raised.
      static RetryStrategy onStatus​(BiFunction<HttpStatus,Throwable,Backoff> backoffFunction)
      Returns the RetryStrategy that decides to retry the request using the specified backoffFunction.
      static RetryStrategy onUnprocessed()
      A RetryStrategy that retries only on UnprocessedRequestException with the Backoff.ofDefault().
      static RetryStrategy onUnprocessed​(Backoff backoff)
      A RetryStrategy that retries only on UnprocessedRequestException with the specified Backoff.
      CompletionStage<Backoff> shouldRetry​(ClientRequestContext ctx, Throwable cause)
      Returns a CompletionStage that contains Backoff which will be used for retry.

    • Field Detail

      • defaultBackoff

        @Deprecated
static final Backoff defaultBackoff
        Deprecated.
        Use Backoff.ofDefault().
        The default Backoff implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • never

        static RetryStrategy never()
        A RetryStrategy that defines a retry should not be performed.

      • onUnprocessed

        static RetryStrategy onUnprocessed()
        A RetryStrategy that retries only on UnprocessedRequestException with the Backoff.ofDefault().

      • onUnprocessed

        static RetryStrategy onUnprocessed​(Backoff backoff)
        A RetryStrategy that retries only on UnprocessedRequestException with the specified Backoff.

      • onServerErrorStatus

        static RetryStrategy onServerErrorStatus()
        Returns the RetryStrategy that retries the request with the Backoff.ofDefault() when the response status matches HttpStatusClass.SERVER_ERROR or an Exception is raised.

      • onServerErrorStatus

        static RetryStrategy onServerErrorStatus​(Backoff backoff)
        Returns the RetryStrategy that retries the request with the specified backoff when the response status matches HttpStatusClass.SERVER_ERROR or an Exception is raised.

      • onStatus

        static RetryStrategy onStatus​(BiFunction<HttpStatus,Throwable,Backoff> backoffFunction)
        Returns the RetryStrategy that decides to retry the request using the specified backoffFunction.
        Parameters:
        backoffFunction - the BiFunction that returns the Backoff or null according to the HttpStatus and Throwable

      • shouldRetry

        CompletionStage<Backoff> shouldRetry​(ClientRequestContext ctx,
                                     @Nullable
                                     Throwable cause)
        Returns a CompletionStage that contains Backoff which will be used for retry. If the condition does not match, this will return a CompletionStage completed with null to stop retry attempt. Note that ResponseTimeoutException is not retriable for the whole retry, but only for each attempt. To retrieve the response HttpHeaders, you can use the specified ClientRequestContext: 
        
 CompletionStage<Backoff> shouldRetry(ClientRequestContext ctx, @Nullable Throwable cause) {
     if (cause != null) {
         return CompletableFuture.completedFuture(backoff);
     }

     HttpHeaders responseHeaders = ctx.log().responseHeaders();
     if (responseHeaders.status().codeClass() == HttpStatusClass.SERVER_ERROR) {
         return CompletableFuture.completedFuture(backoff);
     }
     ...
 }
        Parameters:
        ctx - the ClientRequestContext of this request
        cause - the Throwable which is raised while sending a request. null it there's no exception.
        See Also:
        RetryingClientBuilder.responseTimeoutMillisForEachAttempt(long), Per-attempt timeout
